definition: to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to invite applications for a job/to recruit
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
betrothal money (given to the bride's family)

sentences.english: Today I received a telegram from National San Lü University offering me a position as professor.
sentences.chinese: 我今天收到國立三閭大學電報，聘我當教授。

sentences.english: All the workers hired by the factory can get a year-end bonus.
sentences.chinese: 工廠裏所有的在聘職工都可以領到年終獎金。

sentences.english: Increasing employee retention means improving hiring efforts .
sentences.chinese: 加強僱員陣容，意味着改善在聘僱上的努力。

sentences.english: A small hotel usually employs an outside accountant to check its books periodically.
sentences.chinese: 小酒店通常聘一位外面的會計師定期覈對賬本。

sentences.english: Special to employ seafarers post, hope that the leadership of more concern.
sentences.chinese: 特來聘海員一職，希望各位領導多多關照。

sentences.english: I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 也以誠實聘你歸我，你就必認識我耶和華。

sentences.english: I cannot accept you as my assistant.
sentences.chinese: 我不能聘你爲我的助理。

sentences.english: I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 以誠實聘你歸我，你就必認識我耶和華。

sentences.english: A few months later, toby signed vinnie to do a sketch in his show .
sentences.chinese: 幾個月以後，託比聘威尼在他的節目中演一個小品。

sentences.english: These financial statements have not been audited.
sentences.chinese: 財務報表並未聘任何稽覈人員進行稽查。

definition: to seek to recruit/to invite job applications from
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
full-time/to appoint sb to a specific task
